general.label: Extension Configuration

enabled.label: Module Enabled
enabled.comment: A valid license key is required in order to enable the module. If the module is disabled, your order numbers will use the default Magento order number format.

enabled.label: Enable Custom Order Number
enabled.comment: Can be enabled/disabled per website/store view. Make sure to enable this if you want to use any of the below configuration/features.

id_format.label: Order Number Format
id_format.comment:
Sample formats:
ORD%counter% (if %counter% is 10043 this outputs ORD10043)
O-%YYYY%-%counter% (if %counter% is 1001 and year is 2014 this outputs O-2014-1001)

Important note:
Always make sure your order numbers are unique somehow. It is recommended to at least use the %counter% variable in the order number to avoid duplicate order numbers, as this variable is unique and incrementing.

The following variables can be used:
%d% (day of the month, no leading 0)
%dd% (day of the month, 2 digits always)
%m% (month of the year, no leading 0)
%mm% (month of the year, 2 digits always)
%yy% (current year, 2 digits)
%yyyy% (current year, 4 digits)
%h% (current time: hour, no leading 0)
%hh% (current time: hour, 2 digits always)
%ii% (current time: minute, 2 digits always)
%ss% (current time: seconds, 2 digits always)
%store_id% (Store ID the order was placed in)
%counter% (An incrementing number, configuration below)
%rand3% (Random number between 100 and 999)
%rand4% (Random number between 1000 and 9999)
%rand5% (Random number between 10000 and 99999)
%rand6% (Random number between 100000 and 999999)
%rand7% (Random number between 1000000 and 9999999)
%rand8% (Random number between 10000000 and 99999999)
%rand9% (Random number between 100000000 and 999999999)

count_from.label: Counter: Start counting from
count_from.comment: This is the %counter% variable that can be used in the custom order number format field above. This configures from which number the %counter% variable begins counting. If you use "Reset counter", the %counter% variable will start from the value entered here after being reset.

unique_per_website.label: Counter: Unique per website
unique_per_website.comment: This website should have its own counter.

unique_per_store.label: Counter: Unique per store view
unique_per_store.comment: This store view should have its own counter.

increment_by.label: Counter: Increment by
increment_by.comment: If set to 1, the %counter% variable increases by 1 for every new order placed. If set to 7, the %counter% variable increases by 7 for every new order placed.

padding.label: Counter: Number Padding
padding.comment: If you want the %counter% variable to be 6 digits long with zeros at the beginning of the counter, enter 6 in this field. For example if the counter is at 12, it would output 000012 then, so it's always a 6 digit number (6 is the padding).

reset_counter.label: Counter: Reset counter automatically
reset_counter.comment: How often should the %counter% variable be reset? Make sure to have dynamic parts (like the date) in the order number format to avoid duplicate order numbers!

force_reset_counter.label: Counter: Force counter reset now
force_reset_counter.comment: If set to "Yes", the %counter% variable will be reset when the next increment ID is generated and will then deactivate this option automatically. This means the %counter% variable is just reset for the next increment ID.

enabled.label: Enable Custom Invoice Number
enabled.comment: Can be enabled/disabled per website/store view. Make sure to enable this if you want to use any of the below configuration/features.

same_as_order.label: Same as order number
same_as_order.comment: If enabled, the invoice number will use the order number the invoice belongs to, which means the invoice number is the same as the order number.

id_prefix.label: Invoice Prefix
id_prefix.comment: The prefix entered here will be added in front of the invoice ID. If the order number is 2014-1245, and you enter INV- as the prefix, the invoice ID will be INV-2014-1245

replace_in_id.label: Replace in order number
replace_in_id.comment: If you want to replace something in the order number (which will be used as the invoice number), you can enter it here. If your order number is ORD-1234 you can enter ORD- here and ORD- would then be replaced when used as the invoice number.
